question.text: Which of the following is true for disease in families A and B?

options.text: In family A, both the parents are carrier for the sex-linked recessive disorder.
In family B, both the parents are homozygous for the sex-linked dominant disorder.
In family B, both the parents are heterozygous for an autosomal recessive disorder.
In family A, both the parents are heterozygous for an autosomal recessive disorder.

solution.text: In family A, both the parents are heterozygous and the diseases represented in the pedigree are due to an autosomal recessive gene. Since parents appear normal, they are a carrier of recessive allele and passes to some of their progeny, as recessive alleles express itself in homozygous recessive condition only.
